hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Asia: India: Encephalitis Vaccine For 20 Million Children

abstract.p: India intensifies efforts to combat Japanese encephalitis, untreatable viral disease spread by mosquitoes that kills one in three children who contract it; will finance immunization of 20 million children before July (S)

block.p: The government is intensifying efforts to combat Japanese encephalitis, an untreatable viral disease spread by mosquitoes that kills one in three children who contract it. India said it would finance the immunization of 20 million children in nine states before July, when the monsoon season brings rains that increase infection rates. It obtained the vaccine, which costs about 25 cents per dose, from the Chengdu Institute of Biological Products, a part of the China National Biotec Corp. PATH, an international nonprofit group, negotiated the lower price on behalf of developing countries.
